doc.title: Ciphertext

value.content: In cryptography, a ciphertext is a scrambled message that conveys information but is not legible unless decrypted with the right cipher and the right secret (usually a key), reproducing the original Plaintext. A ciphertext's security, and therefore the secrecy of the contained information, depends on using a secure cipher and keeping the key secret.

value.title: See also
value.content: • Ciphertext on Wikipedia
